par.text: Selenium is found in several allotropic forms; there is a grey metallic form and a red vitreous (glassy) form. Grey selenium is a semi-conductor; its electrical conductivity is low in the dark, but increases rapidly when exposed to light. The element is reactive, it burns in air with a blue flame to produce selenium(IV) oxide – Se
. Selenium also reacts with the halogens. It reacts with hydrogen to produce hydrogen selenide –
Se. Selenium and its compounds are toxic. Selenium was discovered in 1818 by the Swedish chemist Jöns Jacob Berzelius. Its name is derived from the Greek word
